result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel E. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joel E. Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joel E. Brown was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:28 AM Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney John A. Chavez.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No corrections/changes to revocation packet.  Attorney Klomberg heard on sentencing arguments.  Attorney Chavez heard.  Defendant makes statement.  Discussion on presentence credit, parties stipulate to 391 days credit.  Court allows Attorney Chavez 30 days to supplement record if disputes credit.  Court heard and orders sentence as follows:

12 yrs Wisconsin State Prison 
7 yrs IC
5 yrs ES
CONS to any sentence previously imposed and CONC to any comitment in 14CF277
Defendant is eligible for CIP & ERP
391 days credit
any unpaid fine to be paid during the term of ES
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 11, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Cases called 147CF68 and 14CF277.  Defendant, Joel E. Brown in court, Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Brown is heard on request for child care.  Atty. Klomberg is heard.  Court is heard, would like verification from agent. Mr. Brown responds.  Mr. Brown is requesting leave to go to ultrasound of unborn child 4/12 at 1:30 pm at BDCH.  Atty. Klomberg heard.  Court grants request for furlough on 4/12 from 1-3, contingent on rpoviding documentation to DC Jail that there is an appointment scheduled.  Jail will make assessment of validity.  Mr. Brown heard on potential surgery, Court takes no action on that issue.  Court will allow child care as pursuant to the rules upon agent approval.  Court will do supplemental order upon receipt of approval of agent.
Dodge County Detention Facility Inmate Request to Judge

14CF68 & 14CF277: Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Katherine M. Findley.  Kurt F. Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Findley notes that she recently found out that she has a conflict in these cases and moves to withdraw; State heard - close to time limits on this case; Atty. Findley notes that SPD will be reappointing; State heard on statute and time limits, question on why Atty. Vollan not the attorney of record; Court reviews Def.'s rights, 30 days is up next week; Court notes Def. is not waiving time limits and wishes hearing and will proceed pro so; Court sets next hearing 1/17/18 at 10:30am; State heard further; Def. wishes to speak to State w/o counsel, waives right to same; State to meet with Def. now.  Recalled 4:08pm. Attorney Kurt F. Klomberg appears for the State of WI. Def. Joel Brown appears in court in custody.  Atty Klomberg heard, have come to proposal to resolve matter today - will w/draw petition, lift stay and impose 6 mo DCJ w/Huber for work and treatment ONLY in 14CF68. Def heard, agrees. Court advises right to have hearing, and Attorney. Def wishes to proceed. Court will in case 14CF68 modify sentence and order 6 months DCJ w/out electronic monitoring, with Huber for work and treatment comm. forthwith. Attorney Klomberg moves to w/draw petition for revocation of conditional release. Motion Granted.

(14CF68 & 14CF277) Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Katherine Marie Findley.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file re; issue with jail and def's medications; State calls Jail Administrator Anthony Brugger, sworn & testifies; discussion held; Court heard and will approve revised order re medications; DA's office to prepare order  Hearing scheduled for January 10, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

(14CF68, 14CF277, 15CF89 & 15CF192) Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; Court reviews plea agreement; NGI pleas other than the plea in 14CF277 are withdrawan; Court reviews def's rights; Court reveiws chgs and pens; no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 14CF68 w/o enhancer; no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 15CF192, no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 15CF89; no contest/NGI plea is entered in 14CF277 all counts; parties stipulate to facts; Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty as follows: count 1 w/o penalty enhancer in 14CF68 and count 2 is dismissed; guilty of count 1 of 15CF192 w/counts 2 & 3 dismissed and count 4 is dismissed and read in; guilty of count 1 in 15CF89 and counts 4 & 5 are dismissed and read in and remaining counts are dismissed; Court accepts plea of no contest/NGI in 14CF277 all counts and finds defendant guilty/NGI; Court heard and will order a 4 year commitment to DHS inpatient; Parties make sentencing arguments; defendant makes statement; Court heard and sentence is imposed:

costs

Defendant Joel E. Brown in court with attorney Greg E Vollan.  Yolanda J Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty pleas entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't

Defendant Joel E. Brown in court with attorney Greg E Vollan.  James T Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion held; Court orders witnesses sequestered; State calls Officer Jake Vosters; sworn & testifies; witness ID's def; Court heard and finds prob cause;  Arraignment scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

9:10 Defendant Joel E. Brown in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
